intro: Bikinia congensis, commonly known as the slender rock cress, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, bright green leaves and clusters of four-petaled white or yellow flowers. It typically thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
